H0.text: Stem cells are some of the cells that remain within the heart, continuing to divide and potentially replace dead cells, according to recent evidence.

H1.text: Osteoclast cells are some of the type of cells that remain within the heart, continuing to divide and potentially replace dead cells, according to recent evidence.

H2.text: Human cells are the type of cells that remain within the heart, continue to divide, and potentially replace dead cells.

H3.text: Dendritic cells are the type of cells that remain within the heart, continuing to divide and potentially replace dead cells, according to recent evidence.

A4.text: Stem cell implantation may help in strengthening the left-ventricle of the heart, as well as retaining the heart tissue to patients who have suffered from heart attacks in the past.

A5.text: Bone marrow is a rich source of adult stem cells, which have been used in treating several conditions including liver cirrhosis, chronic limb ischemia and endstage heart failure.
